main event: Bright lights flashing together between Atikokan and Port Arthur, Canada observed on 6 November 1957.
interesting points: The lights appeared polarized, changing from bright white to oranges and greens., The object was estimated to be about 10 to 15 feet in diameter and moved across the sky., The object disappeared over the horizon in about one minute., Three reliable witnesses observed the object from about 300 yards away., The observers thought the object appeared to be a balloon with a flare.
sighted object: bright flashing lights surrounding a solid object
witness description: Reliable witnesses, including at least 45 officers and airmen.
